question: Most common cancer arising from a burns scar is:
exp: Ans: C (Squamous carcinoma) Ref: Bailey & Love's Short Practice of Surgery, 25th Edition 611. Explanation: Squamous carcinoma of Skin. Second most common form of skin cancer. Twice more common in men. Risk factors. UV rays exposure. Chronic inflammation. Chronic sinus tracts. Pre-existing sears. Osteomyelitis. Bums. Vaccination points. Immunosuppression (organ-transplant recipients). Chemical carcinogens (arsenieals, tar)HPV5 and HPY16 infe etion. Tobacco use. Clinical features. Lesions vary from smooth nodular to verrucous, papillomatous and ulcerating lesions. All variants will eventually ulcerate as they grow. The u leers hav e a characterisecally e verted edge. Diagnosis - By biopsy. Management. Surgical excision. Lesion < 2 cm - Excision with 4mm margin. Lesion > 2 cm Excision with l cm margin
